fields.value: Analyzing Drivers of Low Carbon Transitions in Post-Fukushima Japan: A Cross City Comparison of Electricity Consumption

dsDescriptionValue.value:
Annual data on household and business electricity consumption in Japan's 18 largest cities, in gigawatt hours (GWh) from 2001 to 2012. Also includes predictor data for a panel subsetted to 2007-2012, including the density of nonprofit organizations,
environmental nonprofit organizations, and women's and gender equality nonprofit organizations. The data also include indicators for the Fukushima nuclear disaster and several policy responses to the disaster that varied by region.

files.description: An Excel-formatted file containing all available data on household and business electricity consumption in Japan's 18 largest cities from 2001-2012.
files.label: 2001-2012 data_rev.xlsx

dataFile.description: An Excel-formatted file containing all available data on household and business electricity consumption in Japan's 18 largest cities from 2001-2012.

files.description: An R script that reads both data files, produces line graphs of electricity consumption, estimates every model reported in the paper, and produces interpretive quantities of interest for the interaction effects.
files.label: cityElectricAnalysis.R

dataFile.description: An R script that reads both data files, produces line graphs of electricity consumption, estimates every model reported in the paper, and produces interpretive quantities of interest for the interaction effects.

files.description: Codebook describing the contents of the other files. Includes a description of every variable in the dataset as well as details about data sources.
files.label: cityElectricDoc.txt

dataFile.description: Codebook describing the contents of the other files. Includes a description of every variable in the dataset as well as details about data sources.

files.description: Complete data needed to reproduce all models and figures reported in the paper. Includes household and business electricity consumption data for Japan's 18 largest cities, from 2007-2012. All predictor variables are also included, as well as other economic, demographic, and geographic data.
files.label: japanCityElectric.tab

dataFile.description: Complete data needed to reproduce all models and figures reported in the paper. Includes household and business electricity consumption data for Japan's 18 largest cities, from 2007-2012. All predictor variables are also included, as well as other economic, demographic, and geographic data.
